meanings.definition: A molecule that has both hydrophilic and hydrophobic regions.
meanings.sent1: The scientist explained that an amphiphile is like a tiny magnet with two different sides.
meanings.sent2: The soap used in the kitchen is an amphiphile that helps clean dishes effectively.
meanings.sent3: The little amphiphile molecule tried to decide if it wanted to swim in the water or hide in the oil.
meanings.sent4: In the world of molecules, an amphiphile is the ultimate multitasker, balancing between two opposing forces.
meanings.sent5: Imagine an amphiphile as a tiny superhero, navigating between the friendly water and the villainous oil.

meanings.definition: A substance that can interact with both water and oil.
meanings.sent1: During the experiment, the scientist observed how the new amphiphile interacted with water and oil.
meanings.sent2: The salad dressing contains an amphiphile that helps mix the oil and vinegar together.
meanings.sent3: The curious little amphiphile decided to throw a party inviting water and oil to see who would get along better.
meanings.sent4: The versatile nature of an amphiphile is like a mediator between the conflicting water and oil molecules.
meanings.sent5: Picture an amphiphile as a friendly bridge connecting the water world and the oil world.
